name: Fishkill Farms
address: 9 Fishkill Farm Road, Hopewell Junction, NY 12533
notes: Historic 270-acre farm with organic practices; sweet cherry season in mid-July. $5 general admission per group for PYO.

name: Mead Orchards
notes: 100-acre family orchard; sweet cherries usually available late June through mid-July. Open on weekends for PYO in season.

name: Rose Hill Farm
address: 19 Rose Hill Farm, Red Hook, NY 12571
notes: Historic 1798 farm with IPM practices; offers 20+ varieties of sweet and tart cherries from late June to early July. Open Thurs–Sun in cherry season.

name: Prospect Hill Orchards
notes: 7th-generation Hudson Valley orchard. PYO cherries held on weekends from end of June to early July; $5 parking fee during cherry season.

name: Lawrence Farms Orchards
notes: Diverse 30-year PYO farm with scenic views. Sweet cherry season typically late June–early July. Charges a per-person farm admission (applied to purchase).

name: Ochs Orchard
notes: Family farm with farm stand and petting zoo. Sweet cherries available for PYO in late June to early July. Open daily in season (call ahead for crop updates).

name: Wright's Farm
notes: 5th-generation 453-acre farm known for apples and more. Cherry picking in late June through early July. No reservations needed; open daily for PYO when in season.

name: Wickham's Fruit Farm
notes: Large 300-acre North Fork farm (est. 1661). U-Pick is members-only ($20 annual family membership). Sweet cherries available for picking in early July.

name: Fix Bros Fruit Farm
notes: 5th-generation Hudson Valley farm. Sweet cherries usually ripen by end of June. Offers both sweet and sour (Montmorency, Morello) cherry varieties.
place_query: Fix Bros Fruit Farm, cherries, NY

name: Don Baker Farm
notes: Small family farm (Greenport). Offers both sweet cherries and sour pie cherries in season. Open daily 9am–5pm during June for cherry picking.

name: Love Apple Farm
notes: Family farm with market & petting zoo. PYO sweet cherries generally available late June through July (overlaps with tart cherry season). Call for daily availability.

name: Samascott Orchards
notes: Large family-owned U-pick farm with wide variety. Offers sweet cherry picking in season (early summer) alongside many other fruits. No admission fee; open daily.

name: Smith Farms
notes: Small orchard adjacent to Fix Bros in Hudson. Opens mid-June with sweet cherry picking (usually picked out by noon daily). Open daily 9am–5pm while supplies last.

name: Bowman Orchards
notes: Popular Saratoga County PYO farm. Offers cherries, berries, apples, etc. Cherry picking typically in early July; no reservations required (check daily picking conditions).

name: Hicks Orchard
notes: NY's oldest U-pick orchard (est. 1905). Grows both sweet cherries and tart Montmorency cherries. Cherry season starts late June; also known for cider donuts and a cidery.

name: Grisamore Farms
notes: Cayuga County farm market and U-pick. Offers strawberries, raspberries, apples and both sweet and sour cherries. Cherry picking usually begins around early July.

name: Bellinger's Orchard
notes: Montgomery County orchard (since 1930) with 50+ apple varieties plus summer fruits. Sweet and tart cherries ripen in late June; PYO usually runs through early July.

name: Abbott Farms
notes: Family-friendly farm near Syracuse. Offers PYO strawberries, berries, and sweet cherries (in early July). No reservations required; farm market and kid activities on-site.

name: Appledale Orchards
notes: Oswego County orchard with diverse PYO. Offers sweet cherry picking in early July (followed by sour cherries mid-July). Also has berries, peaches, grapes, apples.

name: Littletree Orchards
notes: Ithaca-area family orchard known for apples and donuts. Grows both sweet & tart cherries for U-pick (early July). Season and hours can vary; call or check Facebook for updates.

name: Schutt's Apple Mill
notes: Historic farm & cider mill near Rochester. Offers U-pick sweet cherries when crop allows, typically late June. In 2024 a light crop led to restricted picking by online sign-up.

name: Whittier Fruit Farm
notes: Family-run farm in Gates. Typically offers PYO sweet cherries around early July, though the 2024 cherry season was canceled due to weather-related quality issues. Also has berry picking.

name: Bittner-Singer Orchards
notes: Niagara County orchard with a large dwarf cherry planting. Open daily 8am–8pm in July for PYO sweet cherries. Season runs all month with multiple varieties ripening.

name: Burnap's Farm Market & U-Pick
notes: Lake Ontario fruit farm with cafe and market. Sweet cherry U-pick typically opens in early July. No reservations; also offers PYO berries, peaches, apples and pumpkins.
place_query: Burnap's Farm Market & U-Pick, cherries, NY

name: G and S Orchards
notes: Fruit farm just outside Rochester (Walworth). Offers PYO dark sweet cherries and white cherries from late June through mid-August, as well as tart cherries in July. No entry fee; open most days in season.
place_query: G and S Orchards, cherries, NY

name: Hurd Orchards
notes: Picturesque Orleans County farm and canning kitchen. Grows sweet cherries and sour cherries; PYO offered in July when crops are abundant. Often features special luncheons and events in cherry orchard.

name: Kappus Farms
notes: 150-year-old family farm on Lake Ontario known as "Crazy Cherries." Offers multiple varieties of sweet (dark & white) cherries and also tart cherries. Open daily 8am–7pm during cherry season (late June–July).
